title: Is Israel running out of missiles interceptors? Report claims defence system nearing breaking point
content: Amidst escalating conflict, a report indicates Israel's Arrow missile interceptor stock may be dwindling, prompting US support with additional defense systems. Israel has launched attacks on Tehran, targeting military production sites, while intercepting drones launched from Iran. The crisis intensifies with threats from Iran's leader and potential US involvement, impacting civil aviation and regional stability.

title: With eye on Iran, Trump hosts Pak army chief Munir for White House lunch
content: US President Trump hosted Pakistan's Army Chief Asim Munir, declaring his affection for Pakistan and claiming to have prevented a war with India, despite India's denial of his mediation. This meeting, initiated by a Pakistani-American businessman, occurred amidst potential US action against Iran.

title: India and Canada to reinstate High Commissioners, restart trade talks
content: Narendra Modi and Mark Carney met to improve India-Canada relations. They agreed to bring back high commissioners soon. Trade talks that stopped will start again. Both leaders want to fix things and build trust. They talked about security and economic growth. Discussions also covered climate change and technology.

title: 'Regime could fall': Trump says no decision yet on joining Israel in bombing Iran
content: President Trump has not decided on joining Israel in strikes against Iran, but suggested the regime could collapse. He hinted at potential US action regarding Iran's nuclear facilities, stating a turning point might be near. These remarks follow heightened tensions and Israeli strikes on Iranian sites, fueling speculation about broader conflict.

title: Intel layoffs: 10,000+ factory workers to be laid off; Why they won’t be getting any severance
content: Intel is planning significant job cuts in its foundry division. The layoffs will affect thousands of employees globally. This decision is part of a larger restructuring effort led by CEO Lip-Bu Tan. The company aims to streamline operations and reduce costs. Intel has faced financial challenges and increased competition. Previous job cuts have already reduced the workforce.

title: 90 students from Kashmir Valley among Indians evacuated from Iran: JKSA
content: Ninety students from the Kashmir Valley are expected to arrive in New Delhi tonight after being evacuated from Armenia due to escalating tensions between Israel and Iran. The Indian government facilitated the evacuation of over 100 Indian students. The Jammu and Kashmir Students’ Association expressed gratitude to the government for the timely intervention.

title: From detention cell to future doctor: Kashmir teen cracks NEET after PSA reprieve
content: Zubair ul Islam Bhat, once facing detention under the Public Safety Act for alleged suspicious online activity, has cleared NEET 2025. People's Conference chief Sajad Lone intervened, vouching for Zubair's character and securing his release. This second chance allowed Zubair to pursue his dream of studying medicine, highlighting the impact of compassion and belief in redemption.

title: Elon Musk warns of ‘America bankruptcy’; says all tax revenue will go to paying…
content: Elon Musk has cautioned about the US economy, suggesting potential bankruptcy if the national debt crisis isn't addressed. He highlighted that a significant portion of tax revenue is allocated to interest payments on the $37 trillion national debt. Musk's concerns echo previous warnings about the escalating debt and its implications for the nation's financial stability.

title: ‘I stopped the war between Pakistan and India’: Trump reiterates; says no one reported it
content: President Trump claimed to have brokered a ceasefire between India and Pakistan after Operation Sindoor, a statement Prime Minister Modi refuted, clarifying the deal was initiated by Islamabad. During a 35-minute call, Modi emphasized India's stance on terrorism as actual war, while Trump conveyed condolences for the Pahalgam attack and reiterated support for India's counterterrorism efforts.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Achha baccha hai' - Kapil confident Gill will return with the trophy
content: Shubman Gill is set to captain India in the upcoming five-Test series against England, marking a new era for the team after Rohit Sharma's retirement. Kapil Dev expressed confidence in Gill's leadership and the team's ability to win, despite the absence of key players like Rohit, Kohli, and Ashwin.

title: Asim Munir gets Trump lunch invite after naming him for Nobel Prize
content: Donald Trump claimed to have prevented a war between India and Pakistan, coinciding with his meeting with Pakistan's army chief, Asim Munir. This occurred shortly after Narendra Modi informed Trump that a ceasefire was achieved through military talks, not U.S. mediation.

title: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos-Sanchez wedding: Venice Mayor says 'I am ashamed'
content: Jeff Bezos's upcoming Venice wedding has sparked controversy, dividing residents. While city officials, like Mayor Luigi Brugnaro, welcome the event for its economic benefits and visibility, some locals protest, expressing resentment towards the mega-wedding. The "No Space for Bezos" collective voiced their opposition, highlighting the city's struggle to balance its historical identity with modern tourism.

title: Jammu university law student falls to death from hostel building
content: A law student from Jammu University, identified as Vishal Bhardwaj, tragically died after an apparent fall from his hostel terrace on Tuesday night. Fellow students discovered Bhardwaj unconscious near the building's rear. A resident of Katra, Reasi district, he had taken his final exam earlier that day.

title: US Fed meet: Jerome Powell keeps rates unchanged; defies Trump’s call for cut
content: The US Federal Reserve, under Jerome Powell, held interest rates steady, defying President Donald Trump's calls for a cut. Trump has in the past criticized Powell and dismissed inflation concerns, while other administration officials have joined in advocating for rate reductions.

title: Wayne Gretzky opens up about how his father tried to stop nickname from sticking
content: Wayne Gretzky's iconic nickname, 'The Great One,' faced initial resistance from his father, Walter. Despite concerns about pressure, the name stuck as Gretzky dominated youth hockey. He later embraced it, exceeding expectations with a record-breaking NHL career. Gretzky also commented on the Edmonton Oilers' recent loss to the Florida Panthers. His journey reflects humility, brilliance, and lasting greatness in hockey.

title: ‘I may do it, I may not’: US President Trump teases strike on Iran
content: Amid escalating conflict between Israel and Iran, President Trump has declined to confirm or deny potential US military action against Iran, maintaining strategic ambiguity. He acknowledged Iran's desire to negotiate, questioning why they didn't engage earlier. Trump's statements, coupled with increased military deployments, suggest a possible shift towards deeper US involvement or leveraging the threat of it.

title: 'Someone is filming us': American family sunbathing at Gurugram hotel - watch
content: An American family's vacation in Gurugram, India, turned unpleasant. Sisters Rory and Sage shared videos showing men recording them by the hotel pool. The family felt unsafe due to this intrusive behavior. They highlighted the cultural differences regarding swimwear. The incident raised concerns about women's safety in India. Online users expressed sympathy and concern over the family's experience.

title: It’s not just alcohol! 6 common habits are damaging your liver too
content: Many daily habits silently harm the liver. Excessive sugar intake causes fatty liver. Overusing painkillers strains liver function. Sedentary lifestyles increase liver fat. Unregulated supplements pose hidden dangers. Crash dieting backfires and smoking adds toxins. Being proactive is important. Restrict sugar, move daily and avoid drastic diets. Regular checkups help track liver function. Quit smoking for a healthier liver.

title: Leeds Test: 'It's hot' - Gill and Co might feel at home in dry English summer
content: Leeds is experiencing an unusually hot and dry summer, raising concerns among residents as India and England prepare for their Test series. Locals are taking precautions against the heat, with forecasts predicting temperatures near 30 degrees Celsius. Cricket discussions revolve around the dry pitches and the potential for two spinners in the Indian team.

title: Modi must publicly reject Trump's claim: Cong renews attack after US Prez reiterates 'I stopped the war'
content: The Congress party is demanding that Prime Minister Narendra Modi publicly refute US President Donald Trump's repeated claims of mediating between India and Pakistan to stop a war. This demand follows Trump's statement about his role in preventing conflict, which contradicts India's stance that discussions were bilateral. Congress criticizes Modi's silence and questions the government's handling of national security.

title: Air India cancels 3 int'l flights; DGCA flags technical issues & crew limits
content: Air India faced disruptions with three international flights cancelled due to maintenance, technical issues, and volcanic activity near Bali, impacting passengers who had already boarded. The airline is working to rebook passengers and offers refunds or rescheduling. These cancellations follow increased scrutiny of Air India's Boeing 787 fleet after a recent crash, leading to intensified checks and coordination efforts.

title: ITR e-filing: Can you keep switching between new and old tax regime?
content: ITR filing FY 2024-25 (AY 2025-26): Taxpayers can choose between the old and new income tax regimes annually, provided they don't have business income. The new regime is now the default, requiring taxpayers to actively opt for the old one. This choice can be made at the start of the financial year or during ITR filing, but only if returns are filed by the due date.

title: IND vs ENG: Pant reacts to Ahmedabad tragedy - 'Whole country is disheartened'
content: Rishabh Pant addressed the media ahead of the India-England Test series, expressing grief over the Ahmedabad plane crash and called for the nation to stand together. He also revealed Shubman Gill will bat at No.4 for the upcoming Test against England at Headingley. The series, named the Tendulkar-Anderson Trophy, begins June 20 in Headingley, marking a new chapter in the rivalry.

title: When women kill: Inside the minds of India's killer brides - love, rage and murder
content: In India, a disturbing trend has emerged with young women from small towns accused of killing their husbands, sparking national outrage and misogynistic reactions. These cases highlight societal expectations of women, gender-based power dynamics, and the suppression that can lead to extreme acts. While the crimes are condemned, experts emphasize the need to understand the context of gender, trauma, and societal pressures to achieve fair justice.

title: Chinese scientists set record with daytime laser ranging to Moon satellite
content: Chinese scientists achieved a milestone in space exploration. They successfully conducted satellite laser ranging in Earth-moon space during the day. The team beamed a laser to the Tiandu-1 satellite, about 130,000 kilometers away. They captured the return signal using an upgraded lunar laser ranging system. This enhances navigation in space. It supports future deep-space projects and lunar missions by 2030.

title: 'Mummy is very bad, got pappa killed': 9-year old's statement implicates mother's lover
content: In Alwar's Kherli, a nine-year-old boy witnessed his father's murder, allegedly orchestrated by his mother's lover and accomplices. The child reported that his mother, Anita, stood by as Kashiram Prajapat smothered Veeru Jatav. Anita and Kashiram, who had an affair, plotted the murder. Kashiram hired four men for Rs 2 lakh. Police arrested Anita, while three accused remain at large.

title: 'Iran made a mistake': Trump responds to Khamenei's refusal to surrender; says 'good luck'
content: Amid escalating tensions between Iran and Israel, former US President Donald Trump has sharply criticized Iran, stating they "made a mistake." This response follows Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei's vow against surrender and warning of severe consequences if the US intervenes.

title: Analyst claims Buffalo Bills QB is now the NFL's best
content: Josh Allen’s MVP season with the Buffalo Bills has sparked a major shift in the NFL quarterback rankings. Analyst Sam Monson now places Allen above Patrick Mahomes, citing elite efficiency, record-breaking stats, and consistent dominance. With five straight 40-touchdown seasons and improved decision-making, Allen is making a strong case as the best quarterback in the NFL right now.

title: The Persian Mirror: Why Donald Trump has always hated Iran
content: ​Amid the G7 summit in Calgary, President Trump abruptly walked out mid–chocolate soufflé to deal with “urgent security matters.” The real reason? To green-light what insiders say is a pre-strike contingency plan targeting the Fordo nuclear facility with a 13,600-kg bunker buster bomb—the GBU-57, designed to punch through 60 metres of rock. Later that night, he posted on Truth Social: “Evacuate Tehran. Or don’t. I won’t warn you again.” He followed it with a chilling aside: “Khamenei is an easy target… but not for now.”

title: IND vs ENG: Stokes says Kohli's absence a 'shame', reflects on Indian great's impact
content: England captain Ben Stokes has voiced his disappointment over Virat Kohli's absence in the upcoming Test series against India, acknowledging it as a significant loss for both the series and world cricket. Stokes emphasised Kohli's fighting spirit and competitiveness, highlighting their mutual enjoyment of playing against each other due to their similar mindsets.

title: IND vs ENG: England name playing XI for first Test vs India; Woakes returns
content: England have announced their playing XI for the first Test against India, marking the start of the Tendulkar-Anderson Trophy and the new World Test Championship cycle. Chris Woakes returns, and Brydon Carse makes his home debut. Ollie Pope retains his No.3 position despite competition, while India, under Shubman Gill, seek a series win in England after 18 years.

title: Trump fires fresh salvo at Powell; calls him 'stupid' for not cutting rates
content: President Trump has criticized Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell, calling him 'stupid' for not cutting rates, ahead of the Fed's policy decision. The Federal Reserve is expected to hold steady amidst economic uncertainty, including potential impacts from trade tariffs and rising petroleum prices following escalating Middle East tensions.

title: Iran ‘will never surrender’: Khamenei warns US of 'irreparable damage' if it intervenes
content: Amid escalating Middle East tensions, Iran's Ayatollah Khamenei warned the US against intervention in the ongoing conflict with Israel, threatening “irreparable damage.” This follows a fierce aerial war and inflammatory remarks by US President Trump. Iran claimed to have launched hypersonic missiles at Israel, marking a regional first.

title: 'Rice worth Rs 2': Spicejet passengers insist manager eats same food - video
content: A video showing disgruntled passengers confronting a SpiceJet employee at Pune airport over substandard food served after a flight delay has gone viral. Passengers demanded the staff member eat the same meal, which he did. While the airline denies the food quality claims, the video has sparked online debate, with many praising the employee's composure amidst the passenger's aggressive behavior.

title: Brandon Aiyuk sends clear message to San Francisco 49ers
content: Kansas City Chiefs may target Brandon Aiyuk before the 2025 season. Aiyuk seeks a long-term deal, around $23 million annually. This move could boost the Chiefs' offense and aid Patrick Mahomes. Aiyuk hinted at leaving the 49ers. Experts suggest the Chiefs will pursue Aiyuk if he is available. Mahomes has been training with young receivers.

title: Blow to BCCI: Bombay HC backs Rs 538 cr payout to Kochi Tuskers in arbitration case
content: The Bombay High Court has upheld arbitral awards exceeding Rs 538 crore in favour of the defunct Kochi Tuskers IPL franchise, dismissing BCCI's challenge. Justice Chagla emphasised the limited scope of court intervention in arbitration matters. Kochi Tuskers had played the 2011 season of the IPL before being terminated a year later.

title: Leafs teammates expect Mitch Marner to sign with Western Conference team
content: Toronto Maple Leafs forward Mitch Marner appears headed for a dramatic shift this offseason. According to NHL insider reports, several of his teammates believe the star winger is eyeing a Western Conference team for his next chapter. The move would give Marner distance from Toronto’s spotlight and a chance to start fresh away from Eastern Conference pressure.

title: Top banks cut savings account rates: SBI drops to 2.5%, HDFC and ICICI now at 2.75%
content: Savings account holders will earn less. State Bank of India, HDFC Bank, and ICICI Bank have reduced interest rates. This follows the Reserve Bank of India's repo rate cut. Other banks like Bank of Baroda and Federal Bank have also revised rates. The changes align deposit returns with the easing interest rate cycle.

title: IND vs ENG: Pant confirms India's batting order; sheds light on No. 4 & No. 5 spots
content: Rishabh Pant confirmed Shubman Gill will bat at No.4 in the first Test against England, filling Virat Kohli's spot, while Pant remains at No.5. This reshuffling follows the retirements of Rohit Sharma and Kohli, marking a significant change in India's batting order. The No.3 position is yet to be decided.

title: Iran-Israel conflict: Bunker buster, nuclear breakout time - Key words & phrases explained
content: Amidst escalating tensions between Iran and Israel, a glossary of critical military, nuclear, and diplomatic terms becomes essential. These definitions clarify complex concepts like uranium enrichment, air dominance, and proxy wars, highlighting the strategic depth and potential red lines that could trigger further conflict. Understanding these terms is crucial for navigating the intricacies of this volatile situation.

title: Singer defied Dodgers, belted anthem in Spanish
content: Latin singer Nezza said that she is "super proud" of performing the national anthem in Spanish, despite being discouraged from doing so by the Dodgers, and that she has "no regrets."

title: Ex-player sues Chiefs, cites racial discrimination
content: A former NFL defensive back is suing the Chiefs for wrongful termination from his job as director of player engagement after accusing the franchise of discriminating against him because he is Black.

title: Sources: CB Arnette joins Texans in NFL return
content: The Texans have signed cornerback Damon Arnette to a one-year deal as the 2020 first-round pick looks to make his return to the NFL following numerous legal issues, sources told ESPN.

title: WNBA: No suspensions from Sun-Fever scuffles
content: No players will face suspensions after a pair of scuffles broke out in Tuesday's Connecticut Sun-Indiana Fever game, including one in the final minute that resulted in three players getting ejected, the WNBA told ESPN on Wednesday.

title: LeBron bemoans ring culture: 'It's never enough'
content: LeBron James criticized the discourse around "ring culture" in the NBA, pushing back on the idea that a player's greatness is measured by how many championships he wins.

title: Ruggs apologizes to victim's family at Vegas event
content: Former Raiders wide receiver Henry Ruggs III, on special release Tuesday night, spoke at a Hope for Prisoners event in Las Vegas and apologized to the family of a woman he killed in a car crash nearly four years ago.

title: Rays in talks to sell team to Florida developer
content: Tampa Bay Rays principal owner Stu Sternberg is in "exclusive discussions" to sell the franchise to a group led by a Florida-based residential developer, the team acknowledged Wednesday.

title: 👀 8 deals the Bucks could make involving Giannis
content: Milwaukee could choose to retool its roster this summer. Will the two-time MVP still be a Buck when the dust settles?

title: The ultimate NFL team from past 25 years: Who makes the 53-man roster, practice squad and coaching staff?
content: In honor of hitting the quarter-century mark, we built a 53-man roster of the best NFL players from the past 25 years. Who makes the team?

title: MLB mock draft 2.0: Kiley McDaniel predicts the first 40 picks
content: The Men's College World Series is bringing the top of next month's draft into better focus, starting with a new No. 1 pick.

title: How the Thunder win it all and the Pacers force Game 7
content: NBA insiders answer the biggest questions and what to watch for heading into this massive Finals Game 6.

title: 11 surprising stats that have defined the 2025 MLB season
content: From Aaron Judge chasing Ty Cobb(!) to the greatest season by a catcher ever, a look at some big-time big-league numbers.

title: The NBA draft talent pipeline (once again) runs through college basketball
content: After taking a backseat to other NBA developmental paths, college basketball seems to be reemerging at the top.

title: Updated NBA mock draft with movement in the top 10: How we see Rounds 1 and 2
content: With the draft a week away, Jonathan Givony and Jeremy Woo share the latest intel from around the league.

title: Premier League 2025-26 fixtures: Arsenal's horror start, all the big games
content: The fixtures for the 2025-26 Premier League season are out! Which title contenders have the toughest start and what could shape the race for the trophy?

title: Club World Cup updates, odds: If Man City are to win, they need Foden at his best
content: Phil Foden fired Man City to an opening win over Wydad AC in front of a raucous Philadelphia crowd. Here's what you need to know as Wednesday unfolds in the Club World Cup.

title: The Travis Hunter Experience: How to maximize his fantasy potential
content: Want to play in a league in which you get points for all of Travis Hunter's contributions? Here's how you do it.

title: Why this is the season to try an IDP league
content: Drafting defensive players increases the fun you can have playing fantasy. And this is the year to give it a shot.

title: First Betts, now Devers? Red Sox ownership under fire from fans -- again
content: John Henry & Co. traded another franchise icon. The only thing they can do to appease the Fenway faithful now? Win.

title: Devers and Soto on the decline? Cruz and Greene on the rise?
content: Tristan H. Cockcroft takes a long-term look when it comes to who might be the fantasy stars to have in 2026 and beyond.

title: How every team can qualify for quarterfinals
content: The group stage at the Concacaf Gold Cup is well underway, and here's what every country needs to reach the quarterfinals.

title: Mudryk faces up to 4-year ban after doping charge
content: Mykhailo Mudryk is facing a potential ban of up to four years after the Football Association charged the Chelsea winger with a doping offence.

title: Man Utd fans fume at 'eye-watering' ticket prices
content: Manchester United fans have hit out at the club for what they say are "eye-watering" ticket increases that are a "kick in the teeth" for supporters.

title: Laporta: Barça working on 'really exciting signing'
content: Barcelona president Joan Laporta says the Spanish champions are working on a "really exciting signing" after completing a deal to bring in Joan García.

title: Pep laments 'unnecessary' Lewis red in City win
content: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola described Rico Lewis' 88th-minute red card in Wednesday's 2-0 win over Wydad AC as an "unnecessary" decision by the referee.

title: Lavelle, Bethune, 4 newcomers in USWNT roster
content: 2024 Olympic gold medalists Rose Lavelle and Croix Bethune will join the 25-player United States women's national team roster for the first time in 2025 for upcoming games against Ireland and Canada.

title: Earthquakes' Fisher confirms plan to sell club
content: San Jose Earthquakes owner John Fisher confirmed on Wednesday that he is putting the MLS club on the market, and has hired investment bank Moelis & Co. to help facilitate the sale.

title: Serie A CEO blames TV piracy for Italy decline
content: Serie A CEO Luigi De Siervo has pointed to illegal streaming and the resulting lack of TV revenue as a factor behind Italy's struggles to nurture homegrown talent as the Azzurri strive to return to the World Cup for the first time since 2014.

title: Al Hilal CEO: Ronaldo transfer would be 'unusual'
content: Al Hilal CEO Esteve Calzada says it would have been "a very unusual situation" for his club to have signed Cristiano Ronaldo as the Portuguese forward captains their "eternal rival" Al Nassr.

title: Euro 2025 team-by-team preview, predictions, key players, more
content: The 2025 UEFA Women's European Championship starts on July 2. Here is a team-by-team guide on the 16 contenders.

title: KPMG Women's PGA Championship: From Nelly Korda to Lydia Ko's record chase, storylines to watch
content: The third major of the LPGA Tour season starts Thursday with Korda looking to get back in the winner's circle and Ko trying to add to her impressive winnings.

title: Preferential treatment raises eyebrows
content: Preferential treatment for the mighty would undermine the foundation of the rule of law and public trust in the system

title: CTH Road needs to be widened to boost Thiruninravur’s development, say residents
content: The suburb lacks major hospitals, hotels and parking spaces; there aren’t enough bus and rail services to this thickly populated area, say residents; they demand better connectivity to places such as Kilambakkam, Tirupati and Tiruvallur

title: Warangal students win $5,000 in prestigious Generative AI Hackathon
content: Their project, Content Hub, stood out for its innovative approach to AI-driven social media engagement

title: TGCSB and NALSAR sign pact to strengthen cyber law enforcement in Telangana
content: The collaboration seeks to merge legal education, policy research and forensic capabilities with the TGCSB’s operational expertise, creating a multidisciplinary framework to tackle cybercrime

title: BSNL building AI system to identify and correct defects in services: CMD
content: Multinational companies took years to stabilise, said Ravi, and insisted that the BSNL 4G speeds are much better than that of its competitors

title: Teachers protest after dead lizards were found in snack at Madras varsity
content: The incident happened at the Guindy campus of the university; the dead lizards were found in sundal that was offered to the teachers as a mid-morning snack

title: Telangana man dies of ill-health in Israel
content: He was admitted to hospital three weeks ago and died while undergoing treatment earlier this week, said representatives of Israel Telangana Association

title: CPI(M) on the back foot as its 1977 alliance with Jan Sangh resurfaces
content: An alleged revelation by CPI(M) State secretary M.V. Govindan during a media interview about the alliance puts the LDF on the defensive with the rival United Democratic Front (UDF) seizing the opportunity to capitalise on the dispute

title: CM to inaugurate urban health centre in Adyar next month
content: Protein kit for dialysis patients undergoing renal dialysis were launched at Rajiv Gandhi Government General Hospital

title: Raj Bhavan not a platform for RSS agenda, says Kerala Chief Minister amid portrait row
content: Pinarayi says it is unacceptable to make the Governor’s residence a venue for pushing the RSS agenda. This trend is a direct challenge to the Constitution.

title: CID cracks multi-state job visa fraud; over 100 victims duped
content: Secunderabad-based Eagle Expert Immigration Consultancy duped people by guaranteeing them employment overseas especially in Malta

title: Hindi as third language in Maharashtra schools receives flak, Opposition calls it ‘betrayal’
content: According to the amended Government Resolution (GR) issued on Tuesday, Hindi will be the third language in Marathi and English medium schools for classes 1 to 5; but students were allowed to choose from other Indian languages in the place of Hindi

title: SSUS to host Kerala Institute for Gender Equity
content: The institute aims at integrating gender perspectives into policy-making, addressing gender inequalities, and sharing research outcomes with institutions and partners across the country

title: Two Congress MLAs jailed for blocking Jaipur road in 2014
content: Congress MLAs Mukesh Bhakar, elected from Ladnun, and Manish Yadav, representing Shahpura, were among the student leaders who staged a protest and blocked Jawaharlal Nehru Marg outside the university’s gate for about 20 minutes on August 13, 2014

title: Kashmiri youth who was facing detention under PSA cracks NEET
content: Sajad Lone said on Wednesday (June 18, 2025) that he had intervened with the police to prevent Zubair’s booking under the PSA

title: Gujarat: Bypolls In Visavadar, Kadi Assembly Constituencies To Be Held Today
content: Bypolls to the Visavadar and Kadi assembly seats in Gujarat will be held on Thursday, where the BJP, Congress and the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) have put up their candidates. Votes will be counted on June 23.

title: "Threatened To Kill...": UP Man Arrested For Raping 5-Year-Old Boy, Say Cops
content: "The shopkeeper forced himself unnaturally on the boy and also threatened to kill him if he informed anyone about the incident," Deputy Superintendent of Police Mohammad Fahim Qureshi said.

title: 2 Workers Die After Under-Construction Wall Collapses Into Well In Madhya Pradesh: Cops
content: Two labourers were killed when an under-construction wall collapsed into a well in Jaora tehsil of Ratlam district in Madhya Pradesh, police said on Wednesday.

title: Air India Reduces International Services On Wide-Body Aircraft By 15%
content: Air India has reduced its international services on wide-body aircraft by 15 per cent for the next few weeks. The decision comes after the tragic loss of 241 lives on board Air India-171 flight, which crashed in Ahmedabad.

title: 25-Year-Old Law Student Falls To Death From Hostel Terrace In Jammu
content: A 25-year-old law student died after he fell down from the terrace of his hostel building in Jammu University complex, officials said on Wednesday.

title: 30 Arrested For Attempting To Spark Communal Violence In Assam's Dhubri
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Wednesday said more than 30 people have been arrested in connection with the recent incident in Dhubri where a cow's head was found in a sensitive area, sparking communal tensions.

title: Manipur's Thadou Tribe Body Asks Panel To Recognise 3rd Category Of Displaced People
content: A top body of the Thadou tribe in Manipur has requested the Justice Gita Mittal (retired) Committee, Union Home Minister Amit Shah and Manipur Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla to recognise a third category of internally displaced persons (IDPs).

title: After Crash, Air India Cuts International Services On Wide-Body Planes By 15%
content: Air India has responded to the crash of its Ahmedabad-London Boeing Dreamliner aircraft with a slew of safety and prevention measures that includes massive safety and cutting down on the use of its wide-body planes for international flights by 15 per

title: As Donald Trump Hosts Pak Army Chief For Lunch, What The White House Said
content: US President Donald Trump hosted Pakistan's army chief Field Marshal Asim Munir for a special luncheon at the White House on Wednesday.

title: Explained: How Trump Took A U-Turn On Iran After Israeli Pressure
content: In his inaugural address in January 2025, US President Donald Trump made a promise: "Our power will stop all wars and bring a new spirit of unity to a world that has been angry, violent and totally unpredictable."

title: 'He Died In Fear': Telangana Man, 55, Dies Of Heart Stroke In Israel
content: A 57-year-old man from Telangana, who had travelled to Israel in search of livelihood, died due to ill-health, his family said on Wednesday.

title: Dalai Lama To Issue July 2 Message, Expected To Address Succession
content: The Dalai Lama will issue a message on July 2, days ahead of his 90th birthday and a hugely anticipated decision as to whether he will have an eventual successor.

title: Baby Born To Brain-Dead US Woman Kept Alive Due To Abortion Law
content: A brain-dead pregnant woman who was kept alive in the southern US state of Georgia due to local abortion restrictions has given birth, officials said -- with the mother then removed from life support.

title: Israel-Iran Attacks LIVE: Tehran's Internal Security Headquarters Destroyed, Claims Israel
content: Israel-Iran Conflict Day 6 LIVE Updates: The deadly conflict between Iran and Israel entered its sixth day on Wednesday, with both sides widening their attacks.

title: Iran Crypto Exchange Hit By Hackers, $90 Million Destroyed
content: An anti-Iranian hacking group with possible ties to Israel announced an attack on one of Iran's largest cryptocurrency exchanges, destroying nearly $90 million and threatening to expose the platform's source code.

title: Poll Body To Make Live Streaming of Election Universal, Dry Run For By-Polls
content: The Election Commission of India has announced the implementation of 100 per cent webcasting across all polling stations in the upcoming bye-elections in four states, in a bid to effect transparent, closely monitored elections.

title: Influencer, With 1 Million Followers, Arrested For Honeytrapping Builder In Gujarat
content: A social media influencer who had been on the run for over 10 months after allegedly honeytrapping a builder and trying to extort crores from him has been arrested in Ahmedabad.

title: Gas Leak Continues For 7 Days, Himanta Sarma Says ONGC Response "Inadequate"
content: The Assam government announced financial aid of Rs 25,000 each to about 350 families affected by the gas well blowout.

title: Political Storm In Punjab Over 'Intimate' Photos Of AAP Minister
content: A political storm is sweeping Punjab as Shiromani Akali Dal's Bikram Singh Majithia posted intimate photos of state minister Ravjot Singh and a woman, demanding that he be sacked.

title: FASTag Annual Pass: Price, Start Date, Benefits And How To Apply Online
content: The Centre is introducing a FASTag-based annual pass priced at Rs 3,000 for non-commercial private vehicles.

title: Spaun's stunning U.S. Open victory shakes up Ryder Cup race, plus favorites at The Open
content: Who will be the favorites in The Open? Will J.J. Spaun's unlikely victory propel him to more wins? With the U.S. Open finished, we look ahead in the 2025 season.

title: Who earns 'Beard of the Year'? Stanley Cup final playoff beard superlatives
content: "Best Viking Cosplay Beard" headlines a number of superlatives centered around the annual NHL tradition of growing out playoff beards.

title: Rankings: Caitlin Clark claims top spot
content: Caitlin Clark is No. 1 player in fantasy women's basketball for the first time in her career, while Paige Bueckers cracks the top 10.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Premier League clubs battle for Simons
content: Four Premier League clubs want to sign RB Leipzig midfielder Xavi Simons. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Debunking the 'Man United tax' myth
content: Transfer chiefs have complained for years, but it's on the club to stop paying over the odds for players.

title: State governments duty-bound to provide judicial infrastructure without citing excuses, says Madras High Court
content: Chief Justice K.R. Shriram and Justice Sunder Mohan direct Tamil Nadu government to sanction one additional member for Tamil Nadu State Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission

title: Air India to cut 15% of widebody operated international flights
content: Decision taken mitigate impact of a combination of factors, including inspections and airspace restrictions in West Asia

title: Suspend BJP’s Bhopal MP from Lok Sabha for recent ‘communal remarks’: CPI(M) to President
content: In letters to President and LS Speaker, CPI(M) State secretary accuses Bhopal MP of making “derogatory slurs” against Muslims, violating Articles 15 and 21 of the Constitution with comments on “love jihad”

title: Leaders close to CM Nitish Kumar blocking his son’s entry into politics, says Tejashwi Yadav
content: He also alleged that close aides are taking the advantage of Mr. Kumar’s declining mental acuity and also misusing him to enjoy power

title: Sahitya Akademi Yuva Puraskar announced for 23 writers, and Bal Puraskar for 24 authors
content: The Yuva Puraskar awardees include Advait Kottary in English, Parvati Tirkey in Hindi, Latshmihar for Tamil and Prasad Suri for Telugu

title: India and Croatia to make long term plans for defence cooperation: PM Modi
content: India will enhance investment into Croatia’s critical industries like pharma, agriculture, IT, clean technology, digital technology, semiconductors, Mr. Modi said

title: Chhattisgarh to widen government appointments for kin of cops killed in Maoist violence
content: Such appointments on compassionate grounds will no longer be limited to the same department where the deceased was employed; State Cabinet nod to set up Chhattisgarh Tiger Foundation Society

title: Two dead, three critically injured in landslide on Kedarnath trek route
content: The incident took place near the same spot where a pilgrim died after getting hit by landslide on Sunday.

title: Former MLA P.J. Francis passes away
content: He defeated CPI(M) veteran V.S. Achuthanandan in the Mararikulam Assembly constituency by a margin of 1,965 votes in the 1996 elections

title: There’s growing paranoia about air travel, government should strengthen air safety on ground, rebuild public trust, Congress leader says
content: Separately, former Aviation Minister Praful Patel questioned the silence of Singapore Airlines, which owns a 25.1% stake in Air India, on the Ahmedabad air crash; Singapore Airlines in a statement said it was offering full support and assistance to Tata Sons

title: Defending Saharanpur MP Imran Masood’s remarks, U.P. Congress chief says the INDIA bloc is united
content: The ‘Lok Sabha formula’ would not work for the U.P. Assembly election, Masood has said, persisting with his demand for a reset in seat sharing between the Congress and SP

title: Don’t fall prey to fraudsters promising medical seats, says Minister
content: Karnataka Examination Authority will ensure a smooth and transparent process, according to Sharan Prakash Patil

title: Modi’s tele-conversation with Trump exposed ‘lies’ of Congress: BJP
content: BJP IT cell head Amit Malviya says Congress must stop maligning India’s firm and principled foreign policy just to feed its petty narratives

title: Pandarachira canal in West Kochi to be restored with international funding
content: The move comes close on the heels of criticism that canals in West Kochi were overlooked under the IURWTS, a project to restore six critical canals in the city

title: Bills to amend nuclear energy laws ‘may’ be introduced in Monsoon Session: Minister
content: Centre may consider amendments to Atomic Energy Act, Civil Liability for Nuclear Damage Act as promised by Finance Minister while announcing nuclear energy mission; could remove hurdles for private investment

title: Higher secondary curriculum revision next year, says Sivankutty
content: Education Minister inaugurates Plus One Praveshanolsavam. ‘Koodeyundu Karuthekan’ will be launched to equip students to survive challenges

title: Eight new species found in herpetofauna survey at PTR
content: Five new species of amphibians and three new species of reptiles found. The survey from June 7 to 10 identified 67 species of amphibians and 82 species of reptiles

title: State issues GO extending Medisep for three more months
content: Families who have already exhausted their sum insured or those whose balance sum insured is less than ₹75,000 as on June 30 will also get a basic insurance coverage of ₹75,000  for the next three months

title: Kerala mountaineer stranded on Mount Denali in North America, sends SOS
content: Extreme weather conditions, including heavy winds, stalled his progress and left him stranded at Camp 5, nearly 17,000 ft above sea level

title: BJP, Trinamool wage war of words over West Bengal’s revised OBC list
content: BJP welcomes Calcutta High Court’s interim stay on the notification of a new OBC list; Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee says the revised list will benefit poor people, was prepared by OBC Commission

title: New rules will synchronise use of IST for legal, commercial activities, says Pralhad Joshi
content: It is strategically significant to synchronise all sectors with the IST so that the use of alternative time references, unless explicitly authorised, could be prohibited, says Consumer Affairs Minister

title: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan  rebuts UDF’s election-eve campaign that the CPI(M) tacitly sought RSS votes in Nilambur
content: The CPI(M) says opposing Jamaat-e-Islami’s theocratic ideology was not tantamount to stoking Islamophobia, as alleged by the UDF.

title: Govt probed social media complaints against 20 bureaucrats over fake income, disability certificates to avail reservation benefits
content: Only one case being probed further; 40 UPSC candidates who cleared 2024 civil services examination also under scrutiny for submitting fake documents

title: Rain fury in Thrissur: houses damaged, relief camps opened
content: As of now, 19 relief camps are operational in the district, providing shelter to over 550 people from 197 families displaced

title: Governor chairs review with V-Cs, calls for committee to resolve university issues
content: Bihar Governor Arif Mohammad Khan stresses sanctity of institutions and collective effort for educational reforms

title: Five takeaways from J.J. McCarthy's offseason as Vikings' expected starting QB
content: the world has no shortage of opinions on quarterback J.J. McCarthy . he's not ready to lead the Vikings to super bowl lX in february . "they've really pushed the limits on just what I can handle," he says .

title: From transfers to training, Man City are taking Club World Cup seriously
content: man city boss pep Guardiola says he has "closed a chapter" in the club world cup . the last remaining piece of silverware was safely tucked away in the trophy cabinet . it's been 18 months since Guardiola's emotional speech in jeddah .

title: Why the Panthers are the nicest 'rats' to win the Stanley Cup (twice)
content: the Florida Panthers defeat the Edmonton Oilers 5-1 to become back-to-back Stanley Cup champions . they're the most antagonistic trash-talking bullies in the national hockey league . opponents decry their actions and fans outright loathe them .

title: NFL execs, scouts pick their favorite offseason moves: Where Rodgers, Pickens rate
content: twenty-eight teams are officially off for the summer, with the frenzied nature of transactions fading into the background . this week's minicamp is the ideal time to take stock of the splash moves around the league . a few potential moves remain on the radar, including a potential Jalen Ramsey trade .

title: A wedding during the MCWS?! More than one ring is on the line for Louisville's Tanner Shiver
content: two hundred and fifty people are ready to fill St. Michael Catholic Church near Louisville, Kentucky . the wedding cakes are about to be baked, one white, one chocolate . if everything goes right for Louisville and Shiver, he'll make tv appearances .

title: Why there's a 30-foot, 15K-pound fiberglass tiger circling the Men's College World Series
content: freshman pitcher Evans explains how the Tigers overcame weather delays and a lack of sleep . "LSU Pregame" was the first song, and Greene's uncle, Jacob Stone, steered the 15,000-pound fiberglass tiger around traffic . a man in a Jeep sidled up beside them and rolled down his window .

title: College football's most unbreakable records, from Barry Sanders to Bobby Bowden
content: college football has evolved greatly over the years, but there are some records and accomplishments that have stood the test of time . we've examined the past 75 years in college football, tracing back to the 1950 season, and have ranked the 10 most "unbreakable" records in the sport, listing them in order of least likely to be topped.

title: Alexander joins Ravens, reunites with Jackson
content: the one-year deal with former green Bay Packers cornerback Jaire Alexander is worth a maximum of $6 million . the move gives Baltimore one of the most talented secondaries in the NFL and reunites the two-time Pro Bowler with Jackson, a close friend .
